title: Royal Cafe (Varpur, Mau) single-page mobile-first marketing site

requirements.summary: Implement a single-page mobile-first landing page with in-page scroll navigation across all required sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all requested sections in a single-page layout with anchor/scroll navigation
All key sections are reachable on mobile within 2–3 scroll screens from the hero via navigation/CTAs
Page works without requiring login or any backend data

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout composing Hero, About, Highlights, Menu, Gallery, Reviews, and Contact/Location sections with in-page anchor IDs and smooth-scroll navigation (top nav and/or section CTAs). Ensure no auth UI is required to view content.
Add a compact, sticky mobile-first navigation bar with links that scroll to section anchors (Hero/About/Highlights/Menu/Gallery/Reviews/Contact).
Create the About section component and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.
Create the Popular Picks/Highlights section component and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.
Create the Menu section component and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.
Create the Gallery section component (including enlarged view behavior) and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.
Create the Reviews/Testimonials section component and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.
Create the Contact & Location section component (map + details) and ensure it is rendered from the single-page layout.

requirements.summary: Apply a cozy, slightly royal visual theme consistently across the site (palette, typography, spacing, buttons, cards, section styling).
acceptanceCriteria: Design uses a consistent warm palette with a subtle “royal” accent (e.g., deep maroon + warm cream + muted gold) across all sections
Buttons, headings, and cards share consistent styling tokens (sizes, radii, shadows)
No default/unstyled template components are visibly left in the UI

file_operations.description: Define global design tokens and base styles using Tailwind layers (e.g., CSS variables for warm cream background, deep maroon primary, muted gold accent; consistent radii/shadows; typography defaults) to achieve a cozy/royal feel.
Extend theme configuration to support the Royal Cafe palette/accents and consistent spacing/shadow utilities used across sections (keeping React + TypeScript + Tailwind setup intact).
Apply consistent section backgrounds, typography scale, button styles, and card styling across all sections using the shared theme tokens/classes (avoid generic template look).

requirements.summary: Build the hero section with exact café name/tagline, two CTAs that scroll to Menu and Contact, and a warm/local-feeling hero image.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero displays the exact café name and tagline text
“View Menu” CTA scrolls to the Menu section; “Visit Us Today” scrolls to the Contact/Location section
Hero contains a prominent visual (image) that matches the warm/local café vibe and is responsive (no cropping issues on common phone widths)

file_operations.description: Create the Hero section with the exact text “Royal Cafe” and “Fresh Tea, Great Taste, Everyday Moments”, plus primary/secondary CTAs wired to scroll to Menu and Contact/Location. Use the hero image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-hero.dim_1920x1080.png with responsive sizing and appropriate alt text.
Wire HeroSection into the single-page layout at the top and ensure CTA scroll targets match the Menu and Contact/Location section anchor IDs.
Add the generated hero background image as a static frontend asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-hero.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add the generated logo as a static frontend asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-logo.dim_512x512.png and use it in the hero/nav branding.

requirements.summary: Add an easy-to-scan About section highlighting quality taste, friendly atmosphere, affordable pricing, and comfortable seating.
acceptanceCriteria: About section includes the four requested points in readable, scannable layout (short paragraphs and/or bullets)
Section typography remains legible on mobile without zoom (no overly small text)

file_operations.description: Implement concise, locally authentic About copy that explicitly covers: quality taste, friendly atmosphere, affordable pricing, and comfortable seating for friends/family, formatted for quick scanning on mobile.
Ensure the About section appears after the Hero and is reachable via navigation/scroll anchors.

requirements.summary: Create a Popular Picks (Highlights) grid of editable cards for tea, coffee, snacks, fast food, and specials.
acceptanceCriteria: Highlights section includes at least the requested categories (tea, coffee, snacks, fast food, specials)
Content is readable and consistent; cards stack correctly on small screens
All displayed items are editable via a single in-code data list (no hard-to-find scattered text)

file_operations.description: Implement a responsive card grid for Popular Picks including tea, coffee, snacks, fast food, and specials. Keep all highlight items in a single exported in-code data list within the file (or imported from a single data module) with short descriptions and optional editable price placeholders.
Centralize editable in-code data lists (highlights, menu categories/items, gallery images, testimonials, hours/contact) so updates are easy and not scattered.

requirements.summary: Implement a grouped, phone-optimized Menu section with item names and clearly editable price placeholders.
acceptanceCriteria: Menu is grouped by category with clear headings
On mobile, menu items display in a single readable column without horizontal scrolling
Menu section is reachable via the hero “View Menu” button

file_operations.description: Render menu grouped by category (Tea, Coffee, Snacks, Fast Food) using a single-column, easy-to-scan mobile layout. Pull items from the centralized data list and show optional price placeholders clearly indicated as editable.
Ensure the “View Menu” CTA scrolls to the Menu section anchor and works reliably on mobile.

requirements.summary: Add a responsive Gallery grid with at least 6 images and an accessible enlarged view on tap/click.
acceptanceCriteria: Gallery displays at least 6 images total spanning interior, food/drinks, and customers
Images are responsive and include alt text
On tap/click, each image can be viewed larger (modal/lightbox or equivalent)

file_operations.description: Implement a responsive image grid with alt text and a tap/click enlarged view (lightbox-style modal) that supports keyboard escape/close and focus management basics.
Add the generated gallery image as a static frontend asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-interior-1.dim_1400x933.png.
Add the generated gallery image as a static frontend asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-food-1.dim_1400x933.png.
Add the generated gallery image as a static frontend asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-food-2.dim_1400x933.png.
Add the generated gallery image as a static frontend asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/royal-cafe-customers-1.dim_1400x933.png.

Define the gallery image list (at least 6 entries) referencing the generated assets above plus two additional locally-sourced/static images (also placed under frontend/public/assets/) and provide descriptive alt text for each.
Document where additional non-generated gallery images (2+) are stored under frontend/public/assets/ and remind maintainers to compress images and keep alt text meaningful.

requirements.summary: Add a locally authentic testimonials section with 3–6 review cards (names/initials + short quotes).
acceptanceCriteria: Testimonials section shows at least 3 review cards with short quotes
Review content reads natural and locally relevant (mentions tea/coffee/snacks/hangout)
Layout is readable on mobile (no cramped multi-column text)

file_operations.description: Render 3–6 testimonial cards from the centralized data list, using simple authentic wording and a mobile-friendly single-column layout (or 2-column only on larger screens).
Add locally relevant testimonial data (names/initials + short quotes) that avoids exaggerated marketing claims.

requirements.summary: Implement a Contact & Location section with address text, hours, contact details, Google Map iframe embed, and an “Open in Google Maps” link.
acceptanceCriteria: Section includes explicit text “Varpur, Mau, Uttar Pradesh”
Business hours and contact details are visible and formatted for quick scanning on mobile
Google Map embed renders via iframe, and a separate link to open Google Maps is present

file_operations.description: Add scannable address/contact/hours blocks (explicitly including “Varpur, Mau, Uttar Pradesh”), embed a Google Map via iframe, and provide a backup “Open in Google Maps” link for navigation.
Centralize contact details, business hours, and map link/embed parameters in the single data module for easy editing.

requirements.summary: Ensure responsive performance, accessibility basics, and SEO metadata (title/description) for the single-page site.
acceptanceCriteria: No horizontal scrolling on common phone widths (e.g., 360px)
Images are served as compressed static assets and do not cause noticeable layout shift
Document has an appropriate title and meta description for Royal Cafe

file_operations.description: Update the document title and add a meta description suitable for “Royal Cafe, Varpur (Mau, Uttar Pradesh)” (single-page café marketing site).
Audit and adjust layout to prevent horizontal scrolling at ~360px widths (container padding, grids, images) and ensure headings/contrast are accessible and consistent across sections.
Ensure gallery/hero images use explicit sizing/aspect-ratio friendly layout to minimize layout shift and use lazy loading where appropriate.
